website_summaries.verdict: This economical countersink drill set is ideal for a whole range of professional and DIY applications.
pros: Countersink drill bit set from a brand renowned for quality
Makes it easy to drill, countersink and counterbore in one action
Taper drill bits for faster, more secure fixing
Equipped with hex shank locking system to ensure drill bits stay in place during use
cons: Pilot bits are less durable than countersink – a common problem with all-in-one models

customer_reviews.title: Low quality for a big price.
customer_reviews.text: The quality is so bad I had to double check it’s Dewalt. Bits are wobbly out of box, a good eight or so, countersinks are dull and just tear fibers. I could live with that, but then a hex shanks broke after about a dozen of holes in a soft white pine 2x4. I think I can’t trust DeWalt it terms of quality anymore.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Where is the QA?
customer_reviews.text: DeWALT has a serious QA problem with these bits. All three have a wobble on them from the shafts not being straight. Amazon sent out a replacement set but as my luck goes two out of the three in the replacement set have the same issue. Save yourself some grief and get a different set/brand if you need countersink bits.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: All 3 bits warped with >1/8th" variance at tip
customer_reviews.text: All bits are warped. The #10 wobble was >1/8th of an inch. Totally worthless! At first I thought it was an optical illusion from the taper, but ran them side-by-side next to my Rockler/Insty-Drive tapered drill bits and confirmed the Dewalts are warped or bent. All 5 of my Rockler Insty-Drive bits were solid, straight, and no wobble, whereas all 3 of the Dewalts wobble. WTH Dewalt? Are these knockoffs or what?
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: but suffice to say I'm disappointed with the product and I may have to try ...
customer_reviews.text: The drill bits are connected to the hexagonal shank, and in the set I received they are significantly bent, causing the drill bit to wobble on the tip by as much as 1/2 to 1/4 of an inch. This renders them unusable. The packaging looked okay, but I'm not sure if they took a hit that caused them to get bent or if they came that way from the factory. These may not be eligible for return, but suffice to say I'm disappointed with the product and I may have to try talking to DeWalt, but it's more hassle than if I had tried to find them at Home Depot. Update: Amazon did give me a refund on the bits.
customer_reviews.author: Boatman30

customer_reviews.title: Not made for hardwood
customer_reviews.text: Beware using this on a hardwood like hickory. I tried moving the base down but to make it short enough you have to be on the spiral edges and it wobbles badly. I noticed it being way out of true after a few cuts into the wood and sure enough...snap. Busted at the end and left the bit buried in the wood. Now I have to try to get a harder bit and drill that thing out of there without over sizing the hole. Ryobi makes a set just like this with almost no bit in it to snap. These probably work fine on a wood like pine or fir. But do not use these on a something hard.
customer_reviews.author: Aural Votary

customer_reviews.title: The sizing is good, but the supplied bits were badly bent
customer_reviews.text: The sizing is good, but the supplied bits were badly bent. Unusably so, as a matter of fact. I wasn't really wild about the tapered center bits to begin with, so it didn't bother me that much. I just put the counter sinks on regular drill bits and off I went. They work good. The three stars are only because the supplied pilot bits are such junk. The counter sinks are great.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Cote

customer_reviews.title: Did somebody roll over my package?  Warped bits.
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed. I thought maybe I had dropped the first one with the drill as the bit wobbles. Then I noticed the same thing on the others. I had already thrown out the package. I hope it was not made in China. I would be very upset if this is DeWalts concept of QA.
customer_reviews.author: ERPcon

customer_reviews.title: defective parts.
customer_reviews.text: The drill bit will slide thru the countersink collar and goes all the way thru the project. I was surprised to find out that Amazon will not allow me to return a defective set. They simply said the item was no longer returnable, I just received this tool today .
customer_reviews.author: MIK1948

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart on first use!
customer_reviews.text: I tried the #8 bit and it immediately fell apart on the first use. I tried to salvage it and it fell apart again. I expected much higher quality from DeWalt. I temporarily went back to my crappy Harbor Freight bits just to finish my project. The worst part is that Amazon will not accept a return for "safety reasons". Luckily I got a refund instead, so now I can toss these garbage bits (I hope the garbage collection crew can handle the safety issues!) and buy something made a little better.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Don’t be fooled by the brand name. These are very low quality. They wobble and the shank will break after just one or two attempts into hardwood!
customer_reviews.author: D.H.

customer_reviews.title: Yellow brand is doing it the right way
customer_reviews.text: I really started to like this yellow brand but the price is a big issue some times. This product is good and never failed on me. I bought a cheaper bits before I got this and they broke the first time I used them. Returned them and ordered these. Paid double and got only 3 bits. But they deliver and they are the most common sizes so I don’t feel I’m missing something. Overall I’m happy with the yellow brand products and this also. I would recommend, but one start down for the pricing.
customer_reviews.author: LoLa

customer_reviews.title: Yes, it breaks.
customer_reviews.text: I used only one of the three and that one broke after drilling about 50 holes. Not overheated, not forced, not bent, just broke in the soft maple wood and I had to push it out with a nail driver to prevent discoloration. Unnecessary complication. Waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: TheReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great seller, subpar product (not sellers fault)
customer_reviews.text: I'm Giving the seller 5 Stars, but the product 2. I was actually surprised how cheap-like these are, the one I really needed snapped right where the back of the bit meets the shaft for the drill after the 21st hole. I hope not all DeWalt products do this now because Black & Decker bought DeWalt, for those that own Milwaukee, just know, Black & Decker owns them too. I'm always going to be a DeWaly junkie, I was just disappointed in the craftsmanship of this particular tool.
customer_reviews.author: informant1012

customer_reviews.title: Getter Done Quickly!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second set of these that I have purchased, as well as a couple of singles. I Love these bits. They allow me to build & repair twice as fast as before. Now, for their drawbacks. The glue that holds the actual bit in the fixture eventually fails, making the bit unusable. That is why I have had to replace before. Don't get me wrong, they last for a long time before this occurs. I Love these bits and will continue to purchase and use.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Wright

customer_reviews.title: cheap, lots of run-out
customer_reviews.text: These get the job done, but they are pretty cheaply made. As with some other DeWalt hex-shank drill bits I've gotten in the past, these have a lot of run-out (wobble). The stop collars don't tighten very well and nick the cutting edge. They'll drill and countersink a hole, but are closer to what I'd expect from Harbor Freight, not DeWalt.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design for a tool
customer_reviews.text: The hex Drive portion is only crimped onto a flat on the drill bit. Try to drill a counter sink into a hard piece of wood and the crimp releases and the bit is stuck in the workpiece. Terrible design, what a waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: N. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: I am really happy with Dewalt these days
customer_reviews.text: I own a lot of dewalt equipment, and over all - it is all quality and I am happy with all of it. I can highly recommend these countersinks, too. They were very sharp and since I have older ones and "chinese made" ones I bought at a discount hardware store, I did not realize how sharp a countersink could be and how easily a good, new product is to work with. I will probably toss out all my old ones and just keep these three new ones.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Sands Entertainment

customer_reviews.title: #6 bit is not straight and wobbles as it spins
customer_reviews.text: These were either manufactured wrong or really weak metal. The #6 bit is not straight - so when you put it in the drill and the drill spins - the point does not stay in the same spot - it wobbles. Somehow they are still usable (I guess the drill in my hand wobbles instead of the bit in the wood) and I was not able to return and replace because I needed them immediately on a project as soon as they arrived. But if I had more time I would have definitely returned and asked for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: walter choi

customer_reviews.title: Worst DeWalt tool I ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: Very bad quality. I wrongly believed that these would be like the set I bought twenty years ago. The bits are not straight. They wobble badly making starting the hole a problem. Once they catch the drill vibrates. These are junk. The worst part is they are not returnable for some unknown reason. I looked all over the product page for the return policy and can't find it.
customer_reviews.author: Ironray

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality!
customer_reviews.text: Craftsmanship is not what it should be! They work decent but the fit where the two parts go together is sloppy, you would think being Dewalt brand they would be better quality! I’ve had them for 6 months and have used them several times and have to keep tightening them up because of the sloppy fit!
customer_reviews.author: David Thomson

customer_reviews.title: The number #8
customer_reviews.text: The #8 on third hole came apart from shaft. The machine that pressed was not set right. I had a set for years and that set had lasted very well. I have not used new the #6 and #10 yet.. I have several Dewalt tools and they have worked well. I would buy a different brand next time.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: The drill bit broke on the second use while drilling wood. Shop at Lowes.
customer_reviews.text: The #6 drill bit broke on the second use while drilling wood. Can not return. Avoid this product, shop at Lowes.
customer_reviews.author: Mark N. Time

customer_reviews.title: Did the job (until the tip broke)
customer_reviews.text: Everything was great about it, used it for a small deck project. First, the quick fastener part broke off (can use with impact driver, for quick change). No big deal right? Just use in a drill and tighten with the chuck system. And then the tip broke, which now renders it useless. Im so disappointed especially given the price for it, not the cheapest. I powered on to finish the project, but with out the tip, I lost accuracy and also ease of drilling since I had to apply more pressure.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Must have for your tool box
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these. Never knew these existed until my pop told me about them. The countersink adapter can be flip around if you don’t need them. The way how the drill bit design with the smaller tip helps the screw to hold stronger and better. It is absolutely genius 😍. Plus I found amazon got the best price when I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Redefining Elements

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed!  (That I am just learning about these)
customer_reviews.text: Just got and used these for the first time last week. I am seriously impressed, these things are amazing, hopefully they last. Super fast and easy, my only complaint would be that I had to tighten the bit several times before it stopped spinning, you really have to crank down on them. This will not be my last set.
customer_reviews.author: M. Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Rediculously bad product
customer_reviews.text: This set is truely a POS! Dewalt should be ashamed! In addition to breaking on first project the bits burned and smoked with every use. The chinese should be ashamed. Amazon should not carry such junk!
customer_reviews.author: Richard R. Sadler

customer_reviews.title: Buy another brand
customer_reviews.text: These are junk. The bits are tapered, which serves no purpose. They also all have a ton of runout in them and wobble like hell. I do not recommend these. Big let down for Dewalt.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Damato

customer_reviews.title: Quality Problems
customer_reviews.text: I am just adding another review to warn potential buyers and hopefully encourage dewalt to deliver the quality they once did. I own a finish carpentry business and have purchased these bits dozens of times for at least 10 years. I have always been very happy with these bits. Unfortunately the last several sets i have recieved have been inferior. See other reviewers - I have also had the 1/4 hex shank fall off several bits, and had several bits that did not spin true - so much so that they were unusable. Buyer beware. i am currently trying "The ftg maximum torque " version of these bits and will review after some use. Also considering the snappy brand
customer_reviews.author: Richard D Auman

customer_reviews.title: Bits Were Bent
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the packaging I was disappointed to discover that two of the bits were noticeably bent. I expected better quality from the Dewalt name. Fortunately I was able to receive a refund and will purchase something else to fit my needs.
customer_reviews.author: A. DennisTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Must have for carpenters and cabinetmakers
customer_reviews.text: I love these countersink bits, they are inexpensive and allow you to predrill cabinets and woodwork properly so that it never splits and always lines up flush. These are well valued and can be disposed of once dull and replaced with other drill bits (which they sell separately). I like having the 3 pack as it allows you to predrill for many different screw sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt Tools Rock
customer_reviews.text: I've slowly become a Dewalt tool fan, and these countersink bits have only reinforced my high opinion of DeWalt tools. They produce excellent results in a wide range of woods tried to date, have remained nicely honed, are easy to clean, adjust, and use. Recommended, along with almost all Dewalt tools I've been purchasing to replace my aging and rapidly wearing out Craftsman versions.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Cheap offshore crap.
customer_reviews.text: Crappy metal and poor tolerances. The bits are not centered on the hex shanks and aren’t straight. So much wobble that the small bit broke after half a dozen uses. Others are just as bad. Total junk.
customer_reviews.author: Brett N

customer_reviews.title: Great bits and highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.text: Update 10/14/2018 after some use I am lowering my rating from 5 to 2 due to breakage (see picture) and not lasting very long. I have other brands from my father so no idea what they are and I have been using just fine for a while but always struggled with adjusting them and bits breaking. These are so much better with a tapper bit that makes the starting of the hole so much easier and nicer to drill. The depth adjustment is so easy too. I love these (although I only used one size so far).
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P Overholt

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Broke 2 of these on the same day drilling into pine.
customer_reviews.author: Ben B.

customer_reviews.title: Steer clear of the DeWalt. Get the Mibro Titanium-coated countersink bits, vastly superior to this POS.
customer_reviews.text: 2 out of the 3 drill bits snapped with light use. The countersink adjustment collar is always loose, it's held by two hex screws that are awful and never not secure at all. Steel is very brittle. Wood chips and sawdust gets trapped between the drill bit and the countersink collar, which hinders any subsequent cutting. Honestly save your self the hassle and get better bits...
customer_reviews.author: Faisal Aldaiel

customer_reviews.title: #6 bit broke when moving set collar
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed when the bit broke off upon tightening up the set collar. Very fragile or defective.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Not what you expect from a Dewalt product. The #8 bit and shank separated after light use. This is a non returnable item so do not buy if you expect it to last.
customer_reviews.author: Racrebeli

customer_reviews.title: /var/folders/h3/x_0yrsgx1vb5qw688tl36_200000gn/T/com.apple.iChat/Messages/Transfers/IMG_3328.JPG.jpeg
customer_reviews.text: great size bit while it lasted. I like that there are two set screws to securely hold the stop in place, drill bit is tapered towards the tip, and didn't seem to clog up... Then snap! broke the bit above the stop while tighting the set screw. I'm not hurcles but now I need to make a trip to lowes. Recommend buying parts like this in the store so you can return them hassle free after you open the package. Amazon isn't so nice.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Defective! Refund!!
customer_reviews.text: These broke in the first 15 minutes!! Drilling a 2x4 no less! Not the quality I expect from dewalt at all. Totally disappointed and complete waste, honestly I feel ripped off. I have co7nter sinks that are 10 years old!!!
customer_reviews.author: TONYD

customer_reviews.title: Broken after the first use.
customer_reviews.text: These Dewalt bits broke after the very 1st use. They are non returnable so you have to go the manufacture for replacements.
customer_reviews.author: BDR

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in quality in a trusted brand, but functioned as intended.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for use in my projects in making jigs, furniture, etc. After a week of heavy use with plywood and dimensional lumber, two of them came discounnected from their hex collets. Then one of them also broke off into one of the 2x4s I was drilling! I like the tool as the function is great and exactly what I wanted it to do, but they just didn't last at all seems like bad quality from a company I trust with most of my tools.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Solid Countersink Bits for Home Use
customer_reviews.text: The Good: These bits are the perfect choice for the small home woodworker. I use them to make picture frames, trophy cases and things like that. The countersink collar itself has two set screws which are easily tightened and loosened for adjustment. I haven't had them too long so I cannot comment on the long term durability, but DeWalt makes solid products, so I'm not too worried. The Bad: I have run into a few instances where one of the set screws was a little difficult to screw back in and went in on a weird angle. This was probably my fault, but you do have to be careful when using an Allen wrench to adjust the tiny set screws.
customer_reviews.author: AcidGambit

customer_reviews.title: More China Junk
customer_reviews.text: I used the #8 bit for less than 3 minutes, and it came apart into 2 pieces. I was drilling into pine! Not Hickory or Oak, treated pine! My dog can bite through pine. A complete waste of money. I am embarrassed that DeWalt would put their name on this product.
customer_reviews.author: D. West

customer_reviews.title: Not made to be used, Nothing to see hear
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. I bent the first on while tightening the allen screw on the counter sink. way to soft. Nothing to see hear.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, used them for a door install
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this set to countersink some screws and complete a door install. The countersinks are adjustable, which is nice and the price on Amazon was much lower than my local HD.
customer_reviews.author: UFeng

customer_reviews.title: A must for every tool bag
customer_reviews.text: When Tom Silva (Ask This Old House) says he uses this kind of bit almost daily, . . . .how can you not have some in your tool bag. So far, Dewalt remains reliable for their quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What I've been looking for!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best countersinks I have been able to find. They cut through wood with ease and leave a clean hole. I haven't had them for long, so I cannot speak to the durability, but I will be buying again if they ever stop working. My only complaint is there is no way to set how deep the countersink goes. Changing the depth of the drill bit is easy and works well, but it would be nice to alter the countersink. Other than that, I highly recommended this product. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Breunig

customer_reviews.title: Avoid. Total junk. Twice the cost they should be. Broke after 16 holes.
customer_reviews.text: Total garbage. I own a few yellow tools. These should not have the dewalt name on them. The #8 bit broke after 16 holes in soft pine. These were going to replace a set of “clack and fecker” branded bits of the same design that drilled thousands of holes before the tips got dull. These dewalt bits cost twice as much. The broken bit is kind of useable, but the small diameter shaft that remains slips constantly in the chuck. Hard pass on these.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Grundy

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: The bits aren't particularly sharp and start burning wood unless you go really slow. Countersink bit works as expected. Wouldn't call this great but it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Storm

customer_reviews.title: wobble bits
customer_reviews.text: 2 of the bits wobble badly. Cannot return since I did not check them out right after receiving them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good solid choice
customer_reviews.text: I used this kit over the past week building a washer and dryer table to elevate front loaders. I used two of the three on a total of around 30 holes without any major issues. I did find after drilling four or so consecutive holes that the bit would get quite hot and if I continued I would start burning the wood. This was with using moderate speed and light pressure. The tool worked great otherwise as I had all my screws set very well under the surface so I could fill and paint over.
customer_reviews.author: Donavan Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Defective bit or junk product?
customer_reviews.text: The #8 bit broke while tightening the countersink collar after drilling only a few holes. Defective bit or junk product? By the time I used the bits, it was too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: These bits are great
customer_reviews.text: The point of the bit makes it easy to pinpoint the target area to drill your hole and the built in countersinking saves a step and really speeds up project completion especially if you have tons of holes to drill and countersink.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Carrison

customer_reviews.title: Holes and countersinks all in one process.
customer_reviews.text: I'd never used a drill bit that had a built in countersink before. This is so handy. I used to need two drills to drill the hole and to drill the countersink. I love it. Mine did come missing one set screw but since I only use one bit at a time I am able to just move a set screw from a different bit. It works.
customer_reviews.author: RDRR

customer_reviews.title: Broke 1st use
customer_reviews.text: The #10 drillbit shank separated from the quick-connect on 1st use. Looks like poor quality glue was used in manufacture. Can still use without quick-connect like standard drillbit. Perhaps it might be repaired with Epoxy or some such adhesive. Perhaps this explains the current price reduction.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Better than Ryobi
customer_reviews.text: I had the ryobi countersink bits before these and I like these a lot more. I like the tapered bit, it allows the screw to go deeper before having to "pull" the wood.
customer_reviews.author: Nikolai Cook

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly until it breaks
customer_reviews.text: I really liked using this, but I broke all 3 within one project. The countersink attachment threads blew out very quickly. I love the idea, I just need to find a better made product.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Wood

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy go for BOSCH (Wobbly and poor quality)
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why these have a very high rating.. The sets are wobbly. If you ok with wobbly then buy this. If not go elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Pokoot

customer_reviews.title: These were pretty good. One of them wobbles a bit while ...
customer_reviews.text: These were pretty good. One of them wobbles a bit while drilling but it doesn’t affect me too much. The other 2 are good. I should’ve returned them and got a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Tino

customer_reviews.title: Fast clean cut
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely a fast clean cut. These work great in hard woods and are much faster cutters than any I have used before. They have 2 set screws each and the bit will not slip. The counter sink is just the right size for screw heads to fit in and make for a clean finish.
customer_reviews.author: Gary in Ohio

customer_reviews.title: New Product, Bent Drill or shaft
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as back up to some countersinks that I already owned. I opened the new countersink bits yesterday and attempted to use the No. 10 countersink only to find that the bit or shaft was bent before even put to it's first job. I am unfortunately outside of the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great set of bits when having to put something together ...
customer_reviews.text: Great set of bits when having to put something together with screws. It's so much easier when the screw can be used without being concerned the wood is going to split.
customer_reviews.author: Jim M from Oregon

customer_reviews.title: Quality has declined.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought three sets of these over the past 20 years. This recent package had 2 of the drill bits bent and wobbly. Worthless. The quality of these bits is nowhere near what it used to be. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Satterfield

customer_reviews.title: I loved them - right up until they broke
customer_reviews.text: These bits work great. The taper of the bit is perfect, allowing the screw to spin freely in the first layer of wood and tighten into the second layer. The disappointment came after only limited use, the number 8 bit snapped in two rendering it useless. A replacement bit can be purchased, but at almost the cost of a new set of 3. Also, the countersink cutters are held in place by set screws, which come loose surprisingly often. I'm a fan of Dewalt, but my opinion of these is an overwhelming "meh..."
customer_reviews.author: Audioman751

customer_reviews.title: 2 step countersinking is for the birds!
customer_reviews.text: Smallest bit broke rather quick but i just replaced the fine tip bit with a standard bit. The important part of this is the base the bit goes into that does the countersinking and that works perfect. I don't use the 2 larger bits very often because they make too big of holes for the screws I use. Deducting a star for the fragility of the fine tip bit.
customer_reviews.author: TJStarx

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: First go around, small bit snapped off. Contacted Amazon and then sent me another hoping it was an isolated incident. Nope. The replacement snapped as well. Minor projects as well, nothing heavy duty. Don't buy this as it's not well made
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed, did not work very well with 2x6 treated lumber. The drilling is slow and the countersink slips. Don't buy!
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says and cheaper than most others. Works just fine for me. I love that it is adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several brands of budget friendly counter sink bits. These are the best so far.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Sargent

customer_reviews.title: Not Recommended - 1/2 Star!
customer_reviews.text: What, no 0 star...second one I bought, the first lasted under a day, all 3 broke within a week, figured it was just bad luck. Gullible me, I purchased a second, all 3 if them wobbled so badly, they were unusable. These are garbage, must be some black and decker crap dewalt picked up, very disappointing. To add insult to my injury, tried to return them, according to Amazon, who sold me this garbage, it is not eleigible for a return, even though it clearly states on the order I can return them up to 31 Jan 2017, what kind of scam are you pulling Amazon LLC...I'm not happy with product or seller, off to give Amazon LLC 1 star!
customer_reviews.author: T. Barton

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3rd use...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to trust the older, beefier reviews of this product however I believe there is a product quality issue. There are a lot of "this POS broke after X number of uses..." and I would have to agree. Simply using it on some construction quality 2x4's this broke on my 5th hole.
customer_reviews.author: JBKap

customer_reviews.title: A must have for fine woodworking.
customer_reviews.text: These are a must have for woodworking. I use them quite often. They allow you to both drill a pilot hole and countersink the hole in a single step. They save valuable time. I just bought a replacement set as my first set's #6 broke in the middle of a project. Frustrating at the time, but not enough to prevent me from purchasing another fresh set. I will continue to buy these. Paid $21.21 on July 12, 2016.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie H.

customer_reviews.title: These let you pre-drill the proper way.  They are sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I used to pre-drill with a straight bit. These do a much better job. By drilling a tapered hole, the wood is far less likely to split (since wood has been removed by bit close to the large screw shaft) and the thinner pilot hole at the front still leave a lot of wood to grip. The countersink is an added bonus and saves a step. Great tool for any shop
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected!
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. I only used #8 and it works for me although it feels a little off centered, a tiny bit. But overall this is good drill bit and the countersink depth can be adjusted.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Z.

customer_reviews.title: Broke in a week
customer_reviews.text: The #10 bit broke in less than a week. Do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Siler

customer_reviews.title: A must have for all shops
customer_reviews.text: I bought these based on an article I read about woodworking and how drywall screws didnt hold as well as wood screws. I figured this was a good way to test the theory and boy were they right. The wood screws held so much better and using these drill bits, eliminated a 3 step process I was using to countersink my screws. I now use these exclusively on all my wood projects when I use screws. I highly recommend these to anyone who is doing any woodworking on any level.
customer_reviews.author: paul g

customer_reviews.title: Weak bits
customer_reviews.text: The material the tapered bits are cast from is extremely weak. One bit bent while I was tightening the bolt with the allen key! I was able to straighten it back easily by hand however. Another bit broke the first time I used it when I stopped drilling the first hole and rocked the drill slightly while extracting it from the hole. I have not used the third as yet. I plan on placing the counter sink collars on regular bits once all the original bits break. They do work well once you treat them with kid gloves.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: Awful quality. I can’t believe Dewalt put their name on this junk
customer_reviews.author: Ed P

customer_reviews.title: 4 Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love these bits, they are my standby bits for pilot holes in my woodworking. Sometimes the adjustable collar is difficult to tighten down on the bit which warrants the 4-star rating instead of 5, but these are solid bits. Have not had any risk of snapping these as some have mentioned. If the bit is treated properly, it will perform properly.
customer_reviews.author: Yen

customer_reviews.title: The 2 larger bits were bent so bad they could not be used
customer_reviews.text: The 2 larger bits were bent so bad they could not be used. The box they came in was not damaged, so this is either a manufacturing defect or the bits were bent before mailing. Needless to say, I am not happy.
customer_reviews.author: wcp17

customer_reviews.title: Countersink drill bits
customer_reviews.text: Used these bits to countersink into exotic hardwoods. Easily drills thru very hard woods. I especially like the tapered drill bits. The countersinks stay tight on the drill bits and do not slide up under pressure. I recommend this set
customer_reviews.author: jojo

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: $25 for 3 bits that break after less than 10 uses
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: What do you expect from Dewalt? Great product, reliable and relatively reasonable. It’s got all of that ........
customer_reviews.author: HRS

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: A must need for my wood working projects. Would be nice to have a case to protect and keep them together
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Love my Dewalt. These are very helpful when cabinet building
customer_reviews.author: ROYAL B WILLIFORD

customer_reviews.title: Countersink Drill Piece Set
customer_reviews.text: This is a must tool is you are not using pocket holes. Makes the job much easier with a professional touch. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Brock

customer_reviews.title: The quality is so poor that you'd just be wasting your money.
customer_reviews.text: Three out of three the hex shank twisted off the end of the drill bit. Two of them did it on the very first hole that I drilled--in pine. And one of the drill bits is bent so it wobbles so much it is essentially unusable. Very poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W.

customer_reviews.title: ... these for years and they are hands down the best pilot/counter sink bits I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for years and they are hands down the best pilot/counter sink bits I have ever used. The countersink is easily moved on the bit using hex set screws and can be removed if you don't need it. I like the fact that I can use them on a quick release hex chuck in addition to a standard three jaw drill chuck.
customer_reviews.author: Bob in Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Good products for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say....worked well for me while screwing cabinet face frames together. Hint: back them out a few times and clean out the flutes a few times while drilling each hole, otherwise they will overheat or not be effective.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Garcia

customer_reviews.title: I just took these items out of the package and ...
customer_reviews.text: I just took these items out of the package and all three are not straight. They seem to be seated incorrectly. Impossible to pick a target. I will be asking for a refund but am more than 30 days out. Post-script- Amazon replaced these at no cost. Took a couple of days, but the new ones work fine...
customer_reviews.author: joo

customer_reviews.title: Muat have for any craftsman
customer_reviews.text: These things are the best tool for predrilling holes. The adjustable counter sink is great for all projects
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Must have for cabinet installations.
customer_reviews.text: These worked perfectly for our Kitchen cabinet installation. I look forward to using them for other projects as well.
customer_reviews.author: S. F. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Easy loader makes all the difference for me
customer_reviews.text: I had some older countersinks that had to be chucked up every time and the set screws left something to be desired. I just load these in one impact driver and shoot the deck screws in with another and can't believe how quickly the projects go. The bits seem to be holding up very well. I just bought a set for a friend who is a journeyman carpenter and he really liked them.
customer_reviews.author: D42JEEP

customer_reviews.title: Great bit
customer_reviews.text: I like the taper aspect of this bit, good product, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Bud

customer_reviews.title: ... but Amazon replaced it and the new set was perfect. 4 stars only becayse I had to return ...
customer_reviews.text: 1st set was defective and the set screw was drilled in the wrong place so it wouldn't hold the drill bit but Amazon replaced it and the new set was perfect. 4 stars only becayse I had to return the first set. Step up your quality control DeWalt
customer_reviews.author: Dave Rabin

customer_reviews.title: These Work Very Well
customer_reviews.text: I really like these, but wish they came in a storage case.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D.

customer_reviews.title: Bits could hold an edge better.
customer_reviews.text: Have used for a while and bits have not broke. Bits could hold an edge better.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product from Dewalt
customer_reviews.text: All 3 bits were bent and did not drill properly.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy Chaisson

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: These are premium quality drill bits that are always involved in any project I do.
customer_reviews.author: Name-Classified

customer_reviews.title: Decent for the price. The countersink adjustment could be better.
customer_reviews.text: They are not bad - I've had them for about a year now and I used them a few good times and they work nice. Also, the countersink can be adjusted to compensate for a shorter screw length, but the adjustment could be better (sometimes it slipped). They are a bit expensive, but I think are worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sebas

product_meta.title: DEWALT Countersink Drill Bit Set #6, #8, #10, 3-Piece (DW2535)
product_meta.description:
3 Piece, Countersink Set, Rapid Load System, Durable Rubber Finger Grips For Comfortable Use, Impact & Rust Resistant Nickel Plated Nose, Stainless Steel Interior Parts & Pressure Activated Ball Groove System For Rapid Loading & Strong Retention, Provides Quick & Easy Accessory Changes Without Rechucking, Accessories Have Hex Shank Locking System To Prevent Slipping, Holder Fits All Brands Of 3/8" & 1/2" Cordless & Corded Drills.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
DEWALT DW2535 3 Piece #6, #8, and #9 Countersink Assortment
feature_bullets: The product is manufactured in China
Drill, countersink and counterbore in one step
Four cutter countersink and tapered drill bit provide superior speed and ideal finish
